formula: For any k in {0, 1, 2, ...} and r in {0, 1, 2), we have: if n=6*k+(3/2)*(k)*(k-1)+r*(k+2), then a(n)=3*k+r+1. E.g. for k=3 and r=1, we have n=6*3+(3/2)*(3)*(3-1)+1*(3+2)=32 and so a(32)=3*3+1+1=11. - Francois Jooste (phukraut(AT)hotmail.com), Mar 12 2002
prog: (Haskell)a005041 n = a005041_list !! na005041_list = 1 : f 1 1 (tail ts) where   f y i gs'@((j,a):gs) | i < j  = y : f y (i+1) gs'                        | i == j = a : f a (i+1) gs   ts = [(6*k + 3*k*(k-1) `div` 2 + r*(k+2), 3*k+r+1) |         k <- [0..], r <- [0,1,2]]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 16 2012
